intro: Psychotria bernieri, commonly known as the Amazonian psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Psychotria bernieri is also noted for its role in traditional medicine and as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
